issue.title: Fix broadcasting sidekiq logger to rails logger for rails 7.1

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

body: Encountered the same problem in my gem - https://github.com/fatkodima/online_migrations/commit/9460c2b19d12d2bf7ab74fb0b0c7cc818b670e8d.

Having this issue with `7.1.0.rc1`, which means this will make it into the 7.1 release. Is there any quick workaround from Sidekiqs side, so i don't have to downgrade Rails? 

Update: Oh nevermind, just saw that a fix was merged to main, awesome ðŸ‘ðŸ»

issue.title: Upgrade Rails to 7.1

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

repository.name: miru-web
repository.description: Miru | Time Tracking and Invoicing and Employee Benefits. Built using Ruby On Rails and ReactJS

issue.body: - This PR upgrades the rails version to 7.1

body:
in my case, I solved this issue using sidekiq`7.2.2`
```
gem 'sidekiq', '~> 7.2.2'
```

issue.title: undefined method broadcast for class ActiveSupport::Logger using sidekiq 7.3.0 with rails 7.1.3.4 in Docker

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
Can you help me please?

I am using docker for running the application.
I am running docker with environment variables.
But this error appears when the command `bundle exec sidekiq` is executed.
Also, I am using the latest version of sidekiq

It is odd that when I run the docker build & docker run on Windows OS, the sidekiq is operating fine. But when docker build & docker run on Linux Debian OS the error below is shown.

Is my Dockerfile misconfigure?

I know this is related to this issue: https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/6054
But I cannot fix using the sidekiq latest version.

```
Ruby version: 3.3.4 (2024-07-09 revision be1089c8ec) [x86_64-linux]
Rails version: 7.1.3.4
```


Dockerfile
```
# syntax = docker/dockerfile:1

# Make sure RUBY_VERSION matches the Ruby version in .ruby-version and Gemfile
ARG RUBY_VERSION=3.3.4
FROM registry.docker.com/library/ruby:$RUBY_VERSION-slim AS base

# Rails app lives here
WORKDIR /rails

ARG BUNDLE_PATH=/usr/local/bundle \
    BUNDLE_DEPLOYMENT=1 \
    RAILS_ENV=production

ENV RAILS_ENV=$RAILS_ENV \
    BUNDLE_DEPLOYMENT=${BUNDLE_DEPLOYMENT} \
    BUNDLE_PATH=${BUNDLE_PATH} \
    BUNDLE_WITHOUT="development"

.....

EXPOSE 3000

CMD ["/bin/sh", "-c", "rm -f tmp/pids/server.pid & bin/rails db:migrate & bundle exec sidekiq & bin/rails s -b '0.0.0.0'"]

```

Gemfile
```
ruby '3.3.4'

# Bundle edge Rails instead: gem "rails", github: "rails/rails", branch: "main"
gem 'rails', '~> 7.1.3', '>= 7.1.3.4'

.....

gem 'sidekiq'
gem 'sidekiq-cron'
gem 'sidekiq-unique-jobs'
gem 'activejob-uniqueness'
```


Output console:
```
undefined method `broadcast' for class ActiveSupport::Logger
/usr/local/bundle/ruby/3.3.0/gems/sidekiq-7.3.0/lib/sidekiq/rails.rb:66:in `block (2 levels) in <class:Rails>'
```

issue.title: undefined method `broadcast' for ActiveSupport::Logger:Class

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
Versions:
Ruby 3.2.0
Rails 7.2.2
Sidekiq 7.3.7

https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/blob/c24525bc2aab8ce41c4767cd70410c4b27e0b132/lib/sidekiq/rails.rb#L68

**The problem**
I'm facing this issue: undefined method `broadcast`. I looked into other similar issues, but no success.
The strange thing is that this error occurs only in my production environment. My logger configuration appears to be identical for both the staging and production environments.

```
DEFAULT 2025-01-14T19:08:13Z 19:08:13 sidekiq.1 | undefined method `broadcast' for ActiveSupport::Logger:Class
DEFAULT 2025-01-14T19:08:13Z 19:08:13 sidekiq.1 | /layers/google.ruby.bundle/gems/.bundle/gems/ruby/3.2.0/gems/sidekiq-7.3.7/lib/sidekiq/rails.rb:68:in `block (2 levels) in <class:Rails>'
DEFAULT 2025-01-14T19:08:13Z 19:08:13 sidekiq.1 | /layers/google.ruby.bundle/gems/.bundle/gems/ruby/3.2.0/gems/sidekiq-7.3.7/lib/sidekiq.rb:99:in `configure_server'
```

**Related issues**:
https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/6054
https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/6396
